dialogues.text: Start the motor -- I'll be right back. There is the sound of the engine starting over scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - as MacLean swiftly enters the gate the sentry was guard ing and runs to the corner of the adjacent brick building

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corner of building - as MacLean peers around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MacLean's angle - Lighted window in small building in background.  A man is seated working at a desk.  He has a fringe of bushy white hair and a bald head.  From the silhouette he looks very much like Albert Einstein.  Be- hind the desk at which he is working is the usual para- phenalia of a physicist's lab.  John MacLean in the fore- ground, raises his rifle to his shoulder and steadies it against the corner of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Scientist - with crossed-hairs of rifle telescope sights superimposed on view.  The scientist suddenly leans forward to pick up a book.  As he does so, a glass retort on the shelf behind him is shattered by a bullet. The scientist looks fearfully out the window, then quick- ly extinguishes the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John MacLean - lowering the rifle from his shoulder and staring toward the blacked out window.  Over scene the shrill blast of a police whistle causes him to turn and run out of scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With MacLean car in f.g. - moving away from CAMERA at high speed.  Suddenly two sets of headlights appear in the distance coming toward car with the sound of the sirens over scene.  The MacLean car screeches to a stop, is quickly backed and turned around and comes racing TOWARD CAMERA with the headlights of the two pursuing cars closing rapidly and the sound of the sirens build- ing.  The MacLean car swerves PAST CAMERA at high speed, followed by the two pursuing cars with sirens and there is a loud crash off scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Side of road - with MacLean car turned over in a ditch, and a command car in a position relative to it indicat- ing that it ran the MacLean car off the road.  Four guards emerge from the command car and two others from the second car and surround the wrecked MacLean car. Some of the guards carry carbines; others drawn pistols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MacLean car - the MacLeans are dazed from the im- pact -- as they start to resist the soldiers imprison their arms and lead them from the wrecked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silhouette of a gigantic rocket is in background. In foreground, Ralph Pulzer and Chief Barrows, carrying heavy suitcases, are sneaking around a high steel-link, barbed wire top, fence.  Suddenly a searchlight PANS across scene, and comes to rest on them.  They straighten up, shade their eyes with their hands from the glare and run away from CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- soldier standing by fence.  He raises his carbine to his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt! Another soldier runs into scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - of Pulzer and Barrows running with the suitcases and the searchlight following them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s., shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two soldiers raising their carbines and firing several shots at rapid fire.  Suddenly there is a terrific ex- plosion and the scene is lighted by the flash of the explosion.  The soldiers stagger back with the force wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those suitcases must have been full of nitro-glycerine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good thing we got them before they got to the rocket!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, Fielding and Cricket are sitting.  Pat enters from laboratory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Fielding, would you step in here, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fielding exits into laboratory leaving David and the dog waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll only be a minute, David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - with shelf bearing test-tubes, retorts and equipment in b.g.  Doctors Blake and Metzler enter scene, wearing operating caps and gowns.  Blake crosses to a table and places a covered tray on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (introducing the two men)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Fielding -- Dr. Metzler. (both men murmur "How do you do". Fielding looks at Blake questioningly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Metzler has completed the aut- opsy on the little Wilson girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have -- and my findings are al- most unbelievable.  That child died of a sub-dural hematoma all right, but - this caused it! Everyone crowds around the desk.  Metzler picks up a small hexagonal crystal about a half-inch long with the diameter of a pencil.  Attached to one end is a thin platinum disk, and two small wires run from this to a ruptured platinum globe the size of a small mar- ble. METZLER (Cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found this device inserted in the base of the skull.  And the hemorrhage was caused when this little detonator (points to ruptured globe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: exploded in her brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This crystal was in direct contact with the medulla oblongata.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you suppose that's how they con- trolled Kathy Wilson and impelled her to set fire to her house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very possible -- we've done some- thing similar with white mice -- and have made them follow directional impulses with high frequency oscil- lation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why did the thing explode?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably their method of getting rid of people when they have no further use for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then - David's father and mother -- ? Blake looks at her meaningly and shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings.  David crosses and answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir -- just a moment.  I'll call him. He crosses to laboratory door and knocks.  Door opens and Fielding, Blake and Pat enter Blake's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for you, Colonel Fielding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, David. He crosses and takes the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fielding. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello, Moody. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine -- bring it to the intersection of State Highway eighty-six and Belle Meade Road -- with an operator -- (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. He hangs up phone and crosses, speaking to Blake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Blake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we finally got an earth augur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that for boring into the trap doors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we expect to do, David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gosh -- how soon do we start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kindly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was planning on having you wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping up and crossing to Fielding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- but -- I'm the one that dis- covered this whole thing! -- and, gee, I ought to be there, I mean -- Gee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- all right, but you'll have to follow orders -- like any other soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I will! -- Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better leave your dog here, David, he might get hurt out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right - Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 168.    EXT. MacLEAN'S FIELD - DAY - FULL SHOT A platoon of soldiers are gathered around a Sherman tank, a truck, two jeeps and an earth augur.  Blake, Pat, David and Fielding, in combat uniform, are in a group near the machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the earth augur? 169.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - DAVID'S ANGLE - MED. S Motorized earth augur - (such as are used to dig cess- pools) -- on trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. 170.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - MED. SHOT Lieutenant Blair and Lieutenant Cole enter scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Cole -- These people -- or whatever they are -- react to sound or vibrations.  Send Kelley over to the Northeast corner -- (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- of the field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full drums of live ammunition for your .505 -- and better carry ten rounds of H-E for the 175.  Now get this -- this is important -- tell Kelley to take out twenty Mills gren- ades.  Tell him to traverse the Northern border of the field and to throw the grenades out at short in- tervals.  Got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's to cover the sound of the earth augur.... After that, have Kelley run the tank up and down that corner of the field and create a disturbance. (looking at his watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will proceed at 15:33 on a vary flare from this position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Blair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blair, you have your crew stand by with the earth augur.  On a hand sig- nal from me, proceed to that spot by those three stones -- go six feet north of them and drill a hole until you have penetrated a subterranean passage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as you effect an entrance, take two squads and your demolition team with full attack equipment and stand by for me. (looking at watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got nine minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (saluting and exiting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. 171.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - FULL SHOT Blake, Fielding and Pat are in a group.  David is stand- ing about ten feet apart from them watching the earth augur.  A white uniformed interne enters the scene and crosses to Blake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a low voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy's father and mother and the others have been brought in.  Dr. Metzler is preparing to operate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His aunt has arrived too - she's very disturbed and wants him back at the hospital immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Pat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat, why don't you take David back to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can take my car.  Sergeant Roberts will drive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, David. David turns around and walks up to the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David, we have to go back to the hospital.  Your aunt's waiting to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, gee -- what for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers don't question orders, David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An order is an order, young man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straightening up mili- tarily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sir. Pat moves off scene followed by David. 172.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - MED. SHOT David straggles some fifteen or twenty feet behind Pat, looking reluctantly over his shoulder. 173.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - CLOSE SHOT -- as David traverses a clump of bushes, looking back. A round section of earth opens just ahead to the left of him. 174.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - CLOSE SHOT Pat -- who looks over her shoulder, sees it and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David! 175.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - CLOSE SHOT Top half of David -- as he stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? 176.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - MED. SHOT Pat -- as she screams and runs toward CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out, David! 177.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - MED. LONG SHOT Dr. Blake -- reacting to what he sees --- 178.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - MED. LONG SHOT Reverse shot from Blake's angle as he sees a flap of earth is closing over David's and Pat's screams. 179.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - MED. SHOT Blake and Fielding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got them!  Pat and the boy! (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there! He starts to run toward the spot where David and Pat disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running after him and stopping him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it, Blake, there's nothing you can do now. Blake rages impotently --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat's face -- as she looks up and reacts with terrified scream, shrinking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reverse - Pat's angle. Two Mutants stand over her looking down.  The lighting of the tunnel scenes seems to come from a luminous quality in the walls of the tunnels themselves.  These tunnels are cut through the earth by an atomic heat ray which blasts a hole through the earth and fuses the silica along the walls of the tunnel into a radio-active, phosphorescent glassy-like substance.  (For these shots we will use water glass sprayed on cellophane and back light it with hot arcs.) These creatures are mutations developed by the Martians for physical labor.  They are humanoid in appearance, but are covered with a coarse black hair.  (Flocked baggy tights.)  Their feet are about twice the length of human feet and the four toes of each foot terminate in heavy black digging claws.  The fingers are much long- er than human fingers and are equipped with black, non- retractable digging claws.  A hairless, snout-like nose, similar to a mole's, protrudes from the front of the face.  They are with ears, and beady-like reflecting eyes look out from the hairy mask of the face.  At no time do they utter any sound, for these creatures are telepathic.  One of the mutants leans forward into CAM- ERA with extended long prehensile fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat -- as she cowers back and the long black fingers curl around her wrist.  Pat screams and struggles fran- tically and another long black hand comes into scene and grasps the other wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David is lying unconscious from his fall, momentarily ignored by the mutants.  A mutant grabs at Pat's shoul- der.  Pat struggles frantically.  Her screams revert to hoarse gasps of effort and terror, and in the struggle her dress is ripped.  The long fingers of a hand curl around Pat's neck and squeeze for a moment.  She sudden- ly relaxes into unconsciousness.  One of the two mutants picks her up, the other picks up David.  They lope away with them down the tunnel into infinity and darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two mutants lope past CAMERA carrying the two inert figures.  They disappear around a corner of the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mutants rounding another turn, carrying Pat and David at a loping run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From an open metal trapdoor in b.g. there emanates a stronger light.  The two mutants pass CAMERA and lope toward metal door.  They enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a circular room some twenty feet in diameter, approximately fifteen feet high.  It is composed of a shiny metallic substance similar to polished aluminum. The only rivets in evidence mark the outline of bulk- heads spaced around the perimeter of the walls.  Upper left, near the spiral steel staircase, a low metal table is near the wall.  It is flanked by two stationary met- al benches.  The room is dome-like in structure, and an area twelve feet in diameter and approximately eight feet in height occupies the apex of the dome, which is of a transparent plastic substance.  This is the control tower of the space ship.  A bank of control panels is placed in this structure and a round, cushioned pilot's seat is suspended on a crosswalk of perforated metal girders.  The room is illuminated by a series of circu- lar lights which look like portholes.  Even so, the lighting is in comparative low key.  The two mutants descend a spiral staircase and bring Pat and David to the center of the room and lay their unconscious bodies on the floor.  Then they step back approximately five feet and assume a rigid attitude grotesquely reminiscent of soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bulkhead opens in the upstage wall.  Sergeant Balardi enters, walking like an automaton.  He walks up to Pat, facing upstage.  Then a mutant backs out of the bulk- head carrying a Martian seated on a circular metal tray, which is surmounted by a plastic bell jar.  Another mu- tant enters, supporting the other handles of the metal tray.  A mutant steps forward quickly and places a cir- cular metal drum approximately three feet in diameter and thirty inches in height in front of Pat.  The other two mutants then place the Martian on the drum and step back and assume an attitude of attention:  TRUCK in to CLOSE SHOT - THE MARTIAN -- He is approximately thirty inches in height, dressed in a singlet that resembles soft chain mail.  Over this is a gorget of soft black material similar to velvet.  He is seated, tailor- fashion, on a circular cushion resembling sponge rubber. He is extremely brontocephalic, and his tremendously large skull is completely devoid of hair.  His eyes are small and deep-set and peer from their dark sockets with a strange ophidion lustre.  He is entirely covered by the plastic bell jar, and sits so frozen and unmoving that he appears to be a wax figure until we are suddenly aware of the eyes moving to the right, then to the left, then down, where he focuses upon Pat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat is unconscious on the floor.  She stirs into con- sciousness, sits up, then stands, facing the CAMERA. Her eyes widen and stare straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martian's eyes - staring into CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat is drawn by the hypnotic stare of the Martian.  She fights it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martian, Balardi and Pat.  David is still unconscious on the floor.  Balardi stands stiffly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mechanically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a strained, hoarse voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patricia Collins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the Martian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is from the fourth planet -- which you call Mars.  He wants to know what they plan to do - those people up above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you do -- and you will answer in a few moments. He gestures to the mutants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as two mutants approach Pat and suddenly grab her arms.  She attempts to struggle, but is held in a vise- like grip.  She turns suddenly and stares, her eyes widen further with horror.  A panel on a bulkhead swings open and a mutant pushes a chromium, wheeled operating table into scene.  A tray of surgical instruments is on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surgeon mutant lifts a hypodermic needle and ad- vances toward Pat.  She screams piercingly and hysteric- ally and continues to scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surgeon Mutant -- as he lifts the hypodermic needle of a strange design.  His hands, holding the needle, move out of CAMERA, and Pat's screams stop suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as the two mutants lift Pat's unconscious body and place it on the operating table.  David slowly regains consciousness and sits up, rubbing his eyes in a dazed manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David -- as his eyes become adjusted to the light and he reacts in terror at seeing Pat being placed upon the operating table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts to his feet, screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  No! -- a mutant grabs him and clamps a long black hand across his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David's face -- with the hand across his mouth, his eyes staring in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David's angle - of the mutant surgeon, as he takes up a complex surgical instrument.  In his other hand, he lifts up and examines a tiny crystal capsule, to which is affixed a small spiral wire.  Turning slowly, he moves toward the unconscious form of Pat on the operat- ing table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back of Pat's neck and crown of her head -- The mutant surgeon's hands come in and part the hair just above the nape of the neck. 201.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - MED. SHOT -- with TRUCK in b.g.  Fielding, Blake stand in f.g., looking toward the field.  Just to the left of Fielding, a soldier stands with a signal pistol held ready. Fielding is watching the sweep hand on his wrist watch. He turns to the soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire! The soldier fires a star shell. 202.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - LONG SHOT Star shell exploding over pasture. 203.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - LONG SHOT Sherman Tank -- starting and moving alongside the field. A hand grenade is thrown from the open hatch, rolls to- ward CAMERA, comes to rest on the plowed field and ex- plodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martian in bell jar -- The Martian's head turns sharply as a dull explosion is HEARD over scene.  The lights go up in the space ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as the surgeon mutant removes a strange, complex helmet affair from Pat's head, while two other mutants rush forward and carry the Martian quickly through the bulkhead, closing the bulkhead behind them.  The other mutants race across the room and up the spiral steel staircase, leaving Sergeant Balardi staring after them. Pat lies unconscious on the operating table.  David rushes over to Pat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just outside trapdoor -- as the last mutant enters the tunnel through the trapdoor, two other mutants emerge from a side tunnel carrying a machine mounted on a metal, stretcher-like base.  The machine resembles a large searchlight with a metal megaphone-shaped device fasten- ed to the front of the lens.  Two heavy insulators stand vertically just behind the searchlight part of the machine and they are connected to a thing that looks like a small condenser by two three-inch copper ribbons. O.S. can be HEARD the thumping rumble of the tank treads and a dull sound of exploding grenades.  The two mutants with the machine run down the tunnel out of scene, leav- ing one mutant standing guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as the mutants run past CAMERA with the machine and turn right, through an intersecting tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as the mutants place machine on floor of tunnel and deflect it upward at an angle of forty-five degrees. O.S. the sound of the Sherman tank is much louder.  Also the sound of bursting grenades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as mutants push a stud on the machine and a brilliant rush of flame emerges from the mouth of the megaphone- shaped nozzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roof of tunnel -- as the flame from the atomic disin- tegrator burns a circular hole.  The edges of the hole drip with molten silica, like wax under the flame of a blow torch. (PRODUCTION NOTE: For the full scale shots, this ef- rect can be obtained with a military flame thrower burning away a wax-covered flimsy.  Lycopodiem is jet- ted into flame with compressed air.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as a shaft of brilliant white flame comes up out of the earth and engulfs the Sherman tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldier in open hatchway of tank engulfed in flames. 213.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - MED. CLOSE SHOT - (MIN Tank treads and forepart of tank, as it melts into a shapeless, molten mass. 214.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DAY - FULL SHOT Earth augur -- being removed from the circular four- foot hold in field.  Soldiers with sub-machine guns and miners' lamps attached to their helmets stand by. Lieutenant Blair and his demolition team are carrying their C-two packs strapped across their shoulders. Fielding runs into scene carrying a sub-machine gun. Fielding crosses to the hole and drops down into it and is instantly followed by the men.  As the last of them enter the hole, Blake runs into scene and drops into the hole after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as Fielding and the soldiers, followed by Blake, run past CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as the party approaches a branch tunnel.  Two sol- diers are delegated to explore it while the main party, including Lieutenant Blair's demolition team, proceeds. Fielding turns and suddenly recognizes Blake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to find Pat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- come on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fielding, Blake and soldiers cautiously round turn and come toward CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the soldiers in f.g.  Their miners' lamps light the tunnel at the far end of which the mutant standing guard by the trapdoor, spreads his legs and arms and waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as the rescue party stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the name of time is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Fire on command! Two of the soldiers drop to their knees and aim their guns at lens.  The other four and Fielding raise their guns and aim at the lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mutant -- who starts lumbering forward toward group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rescue party -- with all tommy guns aimed at lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven tommy guns fire a short burst directly at lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mutant - as he is blown over backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rescue party -- running through tunnel toward CAMERA. They step over the body of the dead mutant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as rescue party runs down spiral staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as Sergeant Balardi looks toward ladder and aims his forty-five.  David grabs his arm and spoils his aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as a soldier leaps off the top of the spiral stair- case and knocks Balardi to the floor.  Balardi's pis- tol falls to the floor.  David picks up the pistol...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as Balardi fights furiously with his fists.  A sol- dier knocks him out with the butt of his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fielding) Hey, what's the matter with this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know what he's doing. Take him outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers exit with Balardi.  Fielding turns to David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continued) You go with them, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At door or space ship.  David comes up the ladder and looks up the tunnel where the two soldiers and Balardi have disappeared.  He runs after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as Blake and Fielding run up to Pat, who is still unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat!  Pat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes her, but she does not regain consciousness. Blake picks her up and carries her up the spiral ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David runs toward camera and pauses uncertainly at the intersection.  He doesn't know which tunnel to take. He finally chooses the right hand tunnel and runs out of scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fielding, Blair and his demolition team stare around the space ship.  Fielding crosses and attempts to open one of the bulkheads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to destroy this ship, but we can't afford to take any chances.  Go ahead and place your C-two charges, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blair signals one or the men, who removes his demolition pack and places it near the bulkhead.  He pulls back the canvas cover exposing a clock time fuse.  The other demolition expert is setting his charge at the opposite end of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fielding) What interval shall I set it to fire, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six minutes will give us enough time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demolition expert sets dial to six minutes and pulls firing pin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as two soldiers run into scene from branch tunnel. They stop just around the corner of the tunnel and each takes a Mills grenade from his bag and pulls the pin with his teeth and drops down into position to hurl the grenade into the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two mutants with the atomic disintegrator are pur- suing the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two soldiers - as they wait to throw grenades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here they come! Both of them hurl their grenades down the branch tunnel and flatten back against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as the grenades explode and roof of tunnel caves in, and falls in front of mutants, filling the tunnel with earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as they place the atomic disintegrator on floor of tunnel and direct it toward the piled-up debris.  One of them presses a stud and a bright sheet of flame burns through the debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as the flame burns through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them have it again! They throw two more grenades, which explode, blocking the tunnel again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry -- tell everybody to get out of here.  I'll try and hold 'em off. The second soldier turns and runs out of scene and up the main tunnel to the right.  The first soldier hurls another grenade, which explodes, dropping the roof of the tunnel and blocking it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as second soldier encounters the two soldiers bearing the unconscious form of Sergeant Balardi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass the word -- we gotta get out of here right away! A sergeant takes a whistle from his pocket and blows three sharp blasts, then repeats it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as another soldier HEARS the whistle signal in the distance and repeats it on his whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as Fielding, Blair and demolition team react to the whistle signal and run to the spiral staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as Blake emerges from trapdoor, carrying Pat with him.  A soldier standing at the top of the trapdoor hears the whistle signal in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's emergency retreat!  Get her out of here on the double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blake moves quickly out of scene, carrying Pat with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldier at branch tunnel - as a burst of flame cuts through debris some distance up branch tunnel.  As flame breaks off, he quickly hurls another grenade, which explodes down the tunnel, again dropping the roof. Two soldiers running, halt by the branch tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better stand by with grenades and help me hold these monkeys off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got some kind of a flame thrower that cuts right through rocks and dirt.  Watch it -- here they come again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blast of flame billows out of the tunnel, then blacks out and the first soldier throws another grenade.  The other soldiers also throw grenades against the collap- sing roof of the tunnel.  At this point Lieutenant Blair, his men and Fielding enter scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right -- keep going -- on the double!  Get moving, you two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two soldiers run out of scene, followed by Fielding. Blair signals one of the demolition men to remain and place a charge.  The others exit quickly.  The demoli- tion man who was left behind starts to set the fuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David hurries along the tunnel, approaches another inter- section.  He hears the whistle faintly in the distance and stops.  He is again faced with the decision of which tunnel to choose, and is becoming panic-stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David - the sweat stands out on his forehead as he tries to peer into the tunnel ahead of him.  He starts to turn into the right hand tunnel when he hears faint footsteps approaching.  He is about to call when some instinct prompts him to press back against the tunnel wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mutant is cautiously making his way down the tunnel. He pauses and looks back at the direction from which he came.  He advances a few more feet and reaches the intersection, where he stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David is pressing himself as far into the corner of the opposite tunnel wall as he can.  He is terrified.  As he presses closer to the wall, he dislodges a tiny pebble, which rolls down the wall on to the floor of the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mutant hears the sound of the pebble falling and looks around.  He starts to advance toward where David is standing when a whistle is heard faintly in the dis- tance.  He quickly turns and lopes off into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David waits until the mutant disappears and then runs up the opposite tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The demolition man who set the last C-2 charge is hurry- ing along endeavoring to catch up with Blair and the other men.  He reaches the intersection and bumps squarely into the mutant who is loping up from the other tunnel.  The mutant envelopes the soldier in his huge arms and starts to bend him backwards.  The soldier vain- ly struggles for his pistol, but is like a child in the mutant's hands.  He screams but the mutant covers his mouth with a hairy paw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) Help!...Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blair and the rest of the demolition team hear the faint screams behind them, and turn back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier is struggling, but growing weaker, as the mutant has him bent over nearly double.  Blair and his men round the corner and charge for the mutant, who drops the soldier.  As the mutant leaps forward, he is met by a hail of tommy-gun slugs, and drops in his tracks.  The men pick up the injured soldier and run back up the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- as several soldiers and Fielding run past CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking over shoulder) There they are again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mutants -- entering main tunnel with machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) All right -- rest of you keep moving. You, Sims, and Watson -- give 'em a long burst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fielding, 1st and 3rd soldier firing their tommy-guns toward lens, as they back around a curve in the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind Fielding, 1st and 3rd soldiers as they back around a 90 degree turn and a blast of flame strikes the wall just in front of them.  Fielding and the two soldiers back away from the searing heat, shielding their faces with their arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!  Out of here on the double!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and run down tunnel and out of scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blair and his demolition team enter.  The men carrying the injured soldier continue on.  Blair looks around and signals one of the demolition men to place a C-two charge at the intersection of the tunnels.  Blair looks at his wrist watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier sets the time fuse, pulls the pin and they all exit quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fielding and two soldiers run past intersection and con- tinue on.  Huddled in a dark corner we see the two mu- tants holding the Martian on his tray.  One of the mu- tants is also carrying a strange looking antenna device. They turn and disappear into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David runs toward camera.  It PANS with him as he comes to a dead end, which slopes steeply up.  He stops and looks about him uncertainly. 247B.   INT. TUNNEL - DIFFERENT INTERSECTION - DAY - MED.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: C-2 demolition charge - we hear the sound of the time clock ticking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face of C-2 demolition time clock.  The second hand is slowly moving around.  The minute hand reads: two minutes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David climbs to the top of the slope at the dead end of the tunnel and peers up at the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faint outline of what could be a mutant trapdoor is barely visible in the half light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David stands on his tiptoes and strives to reach the trapdoor, but can't quite touch it.  He frantically sets to work digging at the fused earthen wall, trying to carve a foothold.  His fingers make little impression on the hard surface.  Seeking something to use as a digging instrument, he feels his belt buckle.  He tears off the belt and again starts to dig.  From over head, we hear distant sounds of moving vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trapdoor through which the rescue party entered.  Two soldiers are on their hands and knees lifting the others out of the hole as swiftly as possible.  Balardi and Pat are already in a waiting Jeep, which rolls away out of scene.  The mechanized earth augur is rapidly moving out of scene.  Another jeep races into scene as the injured soldier is lifted through the hole and all the soldiers and Fielding jump aboard the Jeep which moves out of scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeeps and earth augur - hightailing it across pasture, as a burst of flame shoots high into the air through the hole from whence the rescue party just emerged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some distance from the trapdoor, the two Jeeps have stopped by the ambulance.  Fielding helps five or six soldiers remove Balardi from the Jeep.  He fights furiously.  A soldier and Blake are lifting the uncon- scious form of Pat from the Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, let's get them to the hospital. (he gestures toward the soldier who was injured in the fight with the mutant) Give him first aid -- I'll send the ambulance right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver runs to the back of the ambulance, opens it, takes out two stretchers and restraining bands.  Pat, still unconscious, is placed on one stretcher, Balardi is placed on the other, and strapped down with the re- straining bands.  Blake and the driver enter the am- bulance, and it pulls out of the scene at high speed, siren wailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fielding suddenly turns to Lieutenant Cole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with concern) Where's David?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Colonel.  Wasn't he with Lieutenant Blair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Blair, worried) Lieutenant, have you seen David?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, no.  Didn't he come out of the tunnel with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I sent him up long ago.  If he didn't come out with you he must still be down here. (he is frantic) How much time before the demoli- tions go off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his watch) One minute, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fielding makes a move for the jeep.  Blair puts his hand on Fielding's shoulder, stopping him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never make it, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fielding and Blake look at each other in hopeless despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David is desperately digging at the wall of the tunnel. He has clawed away enough earth and rock to almost touch the trapdoor.  He stops to rest, wipes the sweat from his eyes and again attacks the tunnel wall with his belt buckle.

dialogues.speaker: FACE
dialogues.text: It reads:  40 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David is frantic.  He is within inches of the trapdoor and still digging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It reads:  20 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David has reached the tunnel roof and is pushing on the trapdoor.  It slowly rises and the daylight streams in- to his face as he clambers out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting over the backs of Fielding, Blair and Cole toward the center of the field.  David is seen climbing out of the trap door.  Fielding jumps into the jeep - yells at the driver - the jeep roars toward David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jeep tears into the scene.  Fielding reaches out and lifts David into the jeep.  Without stopping, it roars out of scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jeep, with Fielding and David, speeds toward camera. The other soldiers are taking refuge behind the cars and equipment, awaiting the explosion.  Suddenly, there is a violent detonation and a cloud of earth and debris mushrooms into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distant b.g. we see the general activity after the explosion.  Men are picking themselves up from the ground, brushing themselves off, looking back at the crater, caused by the explosion.  In the immediate f.g. a trapdoor opens in the ground and we see the hairy arm of a mutant come into scene.  The rest of his body appears in deep silhouette.  He is followed by the second mutant who is carrying the antenna device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fielding and Lieutenant Cole are in foreground at rim of crater, caused by the explosion.  They are inspect- ing a battered portion of the space ship's instrument panel.  Lieutenant Blair enters scene carrying intricate looking instrument, similar to an altimeter.  He hands it to Colonel Fielding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This instrument seems to be intact, sir. Fielding inspects the instrument and hands it to Cole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears to be similar to our high altitude anaroids. (he then turns back to Blair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you finish checking the tunnels, Blair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  Our demolition charges cleaned them all out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be sure the boys bring in everything they find. They resume their inspection of the space ship instru- ment panel. 254.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - DUSK - MED. SHOT Shooting toward Rocky Ridge.  David walks slowly up the hill.  He stoops and picks up a small piece of metal, which he puts in his pocket. 255.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - ROCKY RIDGE - DUSK - MED. SH Fielding, Cole, Blair and several soldiers, two of whom have just placed some portions of the space ship on the pile.  A sergeant enters scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Metzler just called from the hospital, sir.  The operations were successful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sergeant. He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get back right away! Where's David?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was up there a couple of minutes ago, sir. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for souvenirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Lieutenant.  You and your men did a fine job.  You can report back to the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. He leaves.  And Fielding moves out of scene in the dir- ection to which Blair had pointed. 256.    EXT. ROCKY RIDGE - MacLEAN FIELD - DUSK - MED. LO

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: David is walking aimlessly toward the mutants whom we see in silhouette in the f.g.  David stops and picks up a piece of metal.  He examines it, throws it aside, and sees something closer to CAMERA near where the mu- tants are hiding.  As he starts for the object we HEAR Fielding's voice o.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David! David turns, looks at him, then turns and looks at the object that he was interested in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something up here that might be ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.  They'll get all of that tomorrow.  We've got to go back to the hospital now. David turns and runs back to Fielding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and his aunt, Margaret MacLean, a pleasant, forth- right woman, are seated.  They have an attitude of ex- pectancy.  Cricket is seated on the sofa next to Aunt Margaret.  She is petting him.  It is apparent from the dog's attitude that he knows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've been in there a long time, Aunt Margaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It only seems like a long time, dear. (trying to switch his thoughts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has Cricket had his supper yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse gave him some toast and spinach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll give him some real food when we get home. Fielding and Blake enter.  David jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kindly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father and mother are going to be just like they were before -- before these -- things happened. When I talked to them, David, their only concern was for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to his aunt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They - they didn't know what they were doing -- did they, Aunt Mar- garet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They weren't responsible for any- thing that happened, David.  Now go home with your aunt and get a good night's sleep -- you'll see them tomorrow morning. Aunt Margaret and David cross to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. (turns to the dog)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Cricket, we're going home. They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 258.    EXT. ROCKY RIDGE - OVERLOOKING MacLEAN FIELD - NI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two mutants and Martian - as one of them adjusts a series of rings like a miniature radio direction loop, then presses a stud and violet sparks ripple and dance around the edges of the rings and a shrill, high-fre- quency buzzing sound, broken up like very fast code, emanates from the machine.  The two mutants and the Martian raise their eyes upward and stare into space. Then they look off stage. 259.    EXT. MacLEAN HOUSE - NIGHT - MUTANT'S ANGLE - LON The lights are burning in the MacLean house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David is in his pajamas, Cricket is on the foot of the bed, and Aunt Margaret is pulling back the covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, young man, into bed with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yawning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Aunt Margaret. She ruffles his hair, kisses him, then crosses to the door, turns off the light and pauses before she exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sleepily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. Aunt Margaret exits, closes the door after her.  The CAMERA PANS to Cricket on the foot of the bed.  His ears suddenly perk up and he looks toward the window. He whimpers, then jumps off the bed and patters to the window.  He puts his paws on the sill, looks out and growls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting up in bed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Cricket? David jumps out of bed and crosses to the window.  He looks out into the night.  His eyes widen.  He quickly removes the muslin cover from his telescope and puts his eye to the eye-piece. 261.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - NIGHT - TELESCOPE MATTE SHOT -- of a ball of white fire rapidly descending.  Tele- scope matte shot PANS and the ball of white fire de- scends upon the ridge and dies to a soft glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David -- as he makes quick adjustments of the ocular and again presses his eye to the telescope. 263.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - ROCKY RIDGE - NIGHT - TELESC

dialogues.speaker: MATTE
dialogues.text: -- of round bulkhead opening in section of space ship seen through screen of heavy bushes and trees.  The sil- houette of the two mutants carrying the Martian in his plastic dome enters scene and goes through bulkhead, which closes behind them.  Then the scene is burned out by a blinding white light. 264.    EXT. MacLEAN FIELD - NIGHT - TELESCOPE MATTE SHOT -- as the ball of white fire ascends swiftly and dies away in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David - clutching Cricket against him and staring out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well - gee, whiz!!
